channel.title: Alegbraic-Topology on Script Adults
channel.description: Recent content in Alegbraic-Topology on Script Adults

item.title: The H+ doner and acceptor analogy in universal coefficient theorem for homology
item.description: huh So in the universal coefficient theorem, by taking $R \eq \mathbb{Z}$, we know that there is a short exact sequence: $0 \longrightarrow H_n(C_) \otimes_R M \longrightarrow H_n(C_ \otimes_R M) \longrightarrow \operatorname{Tor}^R_1(H_{n-1}(C_*), M) \longrightarrow 0$ Some interesting cases are when $M \eq \mathbb{Z}_{p} \text{ or } \mathbb{Q}$. This is a problem suggested in [Kup2020]1  ↩︎
